biography:
Coheed and Cambria is an American rock band from Nyack, New York. Formed in 1995, the group incorporates aspects of progressive rock, punk rock, metal and post-hardcore.
All of Coheed and Cambria's albums are concept albums that tell a science fiction storyline called The Amory Wars, a story written by lead singer Claudio Sanchez, which has been transcribed into a series of comic books, as well as a full length novel. The band has released five studio albums, three live albums, and several special-edition releases.
In March 1995, after the split of Claudio Sanchez and Travis Stever's band called Toxic Parents, they formed a band with Nate Kelley called Beautiful Loser. The band featured Stever on vocals and guitar, Sanchez on guitar, Kelley on drums and Jon Carleo on bass. The group was short-lived, breaking up by June 1995 after an argument over gas money. Stever left the band, and the resulting trio was named ShabÃ¼tie, a word taken from African tribe chants that means "naked prey" in the film The Naked Prey.
The band spent nearly a year experimenting with a multitude of different musical styles, including punk rock, indie rock, acoustic rock, funk, and heavy metal. When Carleo left the band in August 1996, Kelley recruited Michael Todd to take his place. Todd, who was primarily a guitarist, picked up the bass specifically for Shabtie. As Shabtie, the band wrote dozens of songs and released their first studio demo Plan to Take Over the World in 1999. The band also released The Penelope EP in 1999, shortly after which Stever rejoined the band.
Kelley left the band during a performance in late 1999. Josh Eppard (then the drummer of his brother's, Joey Eppard, band 3) replaced him. The band went on to release Delirium Trigger in 2000, still featuring Kelley on the drums, but listing Eppard in the liner notes.
name: Coheed And Cambria

discogs.name: Coheed And Cambria
discogs.profile:
A progressive rock band based out of Nyack and Kingston, New York, founded 1995.

[b][u]Line-up:[/u][/b]
Claudio Sanchez - Vocals, guitar (1995-present)
Travis Stever - Guitar (1995, 1999-present)
Joshua Eppard - Drums (2000-2006, 2011-present)
Zachary Cooper - Bass (2012-present)

[b][u]Ex-members:[/b][/u]
Jon Carleo - Bass (1995-1996)
Nate Kelley - Drums (1995-2000)
Michael "Mic" Todd - Bass (1996-2006, 2007-2011)
Chris Pennie - Drums (2007-2011)

theaudiodb.biography_en:
Coheed and Cambria is an American rock band from Nyack, New York. Formed in 1995, the group incorporates aspects of progressive rock, punk rock, metal and post-hardcore.
All of Coheed and Cambria's albums are concept albums that tell a science fiction storyline called The Amory Wars, a story written by lead singer Claudio Sanchez, which has been transcribed into a series of comic books, as well as a full length novel. The band has released five studio albums, three live albums, and several special-edition releases.
In March 1995, after the split of Claudio Sanchez and Travis Stever's band called Toxic Parents, they formed a band with Nate Kelley called Beautiful Loser. The band featured Stever on vocals and guitar, Sanchez on guitar, Kelley on drums and Jon Carleo on bass. The group was short-lived, breaking up by June 1995 after an argument over gas money. Stever left the band, and the resulting trio was named ShabÃ¼tie, a word taken from African tribe chants that means "naked prey" in the film The Naked Prey.
The band spent nearly a year experimenting with a multitude of different musical styles, including punk rock, indie rock, acoustic rock, funk, and heavy metal. When Carleo left the band in August 1996, Kelley recruited Michael Todd to take his place. Todd, who was primarily a guitarist, picked up the bass specifically for Shabtie. As Shabtie, the band wrote dozens of songs and released their first studio demo Plan to Take Over the World in 1999. The band also released The Penelope EP in 1999, shortly after which Stever rejoined the band.
Kelley left the band during a performance in late 1999. Josh Eppard (then the drummer of his brother's, Joey Eppard, band 3) replaced him. The band went on to release Delirium Trigger in 2000, still featuring Kelley on the drums, but listing Eppard in the liner notes.
theaudiodb.biography_fr:
Coheed and Cambria est un groupe de rock américain originaire de Nyack, dans l'État de New York. Formé en 1995, le groupe incorpore des aspects du rock progressif, du punk rock, du métal et du post-hardcore.
Tous les albums de Coheed and Cambria sont des albums conceptuels qui racontent une histoire de science-fiction appelée The Amory Wars, une histoire écrite par le chanteur Claudio Sanchez, qui a été transcrite dans une série de bandes dessinées, ainsi que dans un roman complet. Le groupe a sorti cinq albums studio, trois albums live et plusieurs éditions spéciales.
En mars 1995, après la séparation du groupe de Claudio Sanchez et Travis Stever appelé Toxic Parents, ils ont formé un groupe avec Nate Kelley appelé Beautiful Loser. Le groupe comprend Stever au chant et à la guitare, Sanchez à la guitare, Kelley à la batterie et Jon Carleo à la basse. Le groupe n'a pas duré longtemps et s'est séparé en juin 1995 après une dispute au sujet de l'argent de l'essence. Stever quitte le groupe, et le trio qui en résulte est nommé ShabÃ¼tie, un mot tiré des chants de tribus africaines qui signifie "proie nue" dans le film The Naked Prey.
Le groupe a passé près d'un an à expérimenter une multitude de styles musicaux différents, y compris le punk rock, le rock indépendant, le rock acoustique, le funk et le heavy metal. Lorsque Carleo quitte le groupe en août 1996, Kelley recrute Michael Todd pour le remplacer. Todd, qui était principalement un guitariste, a pris la basse spécifiquement pour ShabÃ¼tie. En tant que ShabÃ¼tie, le groupe a écrit des dizaines de chansons et a sorti sa première démo studio Plan to Take Over the World en 1999. Le groupe a également sorti The Penelope EP en 1999, peu après lequel Stever a rejoint le groupe.
Kelley a quitté le groupe lors d'un concert à la fin de l'année 1999. Josh Eppard (alors batteur du groupe 3 de son frère, Joey Eppard) l'a remplacé. Le groupe sort Delirium Trigger en 2000, avec toujours Kelley à la batterie, mais en mentionnant Eppard dans les notes de pochette.
theaudiodb.name: Coheed and Cambria

discogs.name: Coheed And Cambria
discogs.profile:
A progressive rock band based out of Nyack and Kingston, New York, founded 1995.

[b][u]Line-up:[/u][/b]
Claudio Sanchez - Vocals, guitar (1995-present)
Travis Stever - Guitar (1995, 1999-present)
Joshua Eppard - Drums (2000-2006, 2011-present)
Zachary Cooper - Bass (2012-present)

[b][u]Ex-members:[/b][/u]
Jon Carleo - Bass (1995-1996)
Nate Kelley - Drums (1995-2000)
Michael "Mic" Todd - Bass (1996-2006, 2007-2011)
Chris Pennie - Drums (2007-2011)

lastfm.bio_content: Coheed and Cambria is an American progressive rock band from Nyack, New York. Formed in 2001, the group incorporates aspects of progressive metal, punk rock, metal, post-hardcore, emo-pop, pop punk and alternative rock. The band currently consists of Claudio Sanchez (vocals, guitars, keyboards), Travis Stever (guitars, vocals), Josh Eppard (drums, keyboards, backing vocals), and Zach Cooper (bass, backing vocals). Most of Coheed and Cambria's albums are concept albums based on a science fiction storyline called The Amory Wars, a series written by Claudio Sanchez, which has been transcribed into a series of comic books as well as a full-length novel. The band has released nine studio albums, three live albums, and several special-edition releases. Their most recent releases, the Vaxis saga, is a return to The Amory Wars concept following 2015's The Color Before the Sun, the band's first non-conceptual album since their inception. The Color Before the Sun, The Afterman: Descension, Year of the Black Rainbow and Good Apollo, I'm Burning Star IV, Volume One: From Fear Through The Eyes of Madness all reached the Billboard top 10. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.

theaudiodb.biography_en:
Coheed and Cambria is an American rock band from Nyack, New York. Formed in 1995, the group incorporates aspects of progressive rock, punk rock, metal and post-hardcore.
All of Coheed and Cambria's albums are concept albums that tell a science fiction storyline called The Amory Wars, a story written by lead singer Claudio Sanchez, which has been transcribed into a series of comic books, as well as a full length novel. The band has released five studio albums, three live albums, and several special-edition releases.
In March 1995, after the split of Claudio Sanchez and Travis Stever's band called Toxic Parents, they formed a band with Nate Kelley called Beautiful Loser. The band featured Stever on vocals and guitar, Sanchez on guitar, Kelley on drums and Jon Carleo on bass. The group was short-lived, breaking up by June 1995 after an argument over gas money. Stever left the band, and the resulting trio was named ShabÃ¼tie, a word taken from African tribe chants that means "naked prey" in the film The Naked Prey.
The band spent nearly a year experimenting with a multitude of different musical styles, including punk rock, indie rock, acoustic rock, funk, and heavy metal. When Carleo left the band in August 1996, Kelley recruited Michael Todd to take his place. Todd, who was primarily a guitarist, picked up the bass specifically for Shabtie. As Shabtie, the band wrote dozens of songs and released their first studio demo Plan to Take Over the World in 1999. The band also released The Penelope EP in 1999, shortly after which Stever rejoined the band.
Kelley left the band during a performance in late 1999. Josh Eppard (then the drummer of his brother's, Joey Eppard, band 3) replaced him. The band went on to release Delirium Trigger in 2000, still featuring Kelley on the drums, but listing Eppard in the liner notes.
theaudiodb.biography_fr:
Coheed and Cambria est un groupe de rock américain originaire de Nyack, dans l'État de New York. Formé en 1995, le groupe incorpore des aspects du rock progressif, du punk rock, du métal et du post-hardcore.
Tous les albums de Coheed and Cambria sont des albums conceptuels qui racontent une histoire de science-fiction appelée The Amory Wars, une histoire écrite par le chanteur Claudio Sanchez, qui a été transcrite dans une série de bandes dessinées, ainsi que dans un roman complet. Le groupe a sorti cinq albums studio, trois albums live et plusieurs éditions spéciales.
En mars 1995, après la séparation du groupe de Claudio Sanchez et Travis Stever appelé Toxic Parents, ils ont formé un groupe avec Nate Kelley appelé Beautiful Loser. Le groupe comprend Stever au chant et à la guitare, Sanchez à la guitare, Kelley à la batterie et Jon Carleo à la basse. Le groupe n'a pas duré longtemps et s'est séparé en juin 1995 après une dispute au sujet de l'argent de l'essence. Stever quitte le groupe, et le trio qui en résulte est nommé ShabÃ¼tie, un mot tiré des chants de tribus africaines qui signifie "proie nue" dans le film The Naked Prey.
Le groupe a passé près d'un an à expérimenter une multitude de styles musicaux différents, y compris le punk rock, le rock indépendant, le rock acoustique, le funk et le heavy metal. Lorsque Carleo quitte le groupe en août 1996, Kelley recrute Michael Todd pour le remplacer. Todd, qui était principalement un guitariste, a pris la basse spécifiquement pour ShabÃ¼tie. En tant que ShabÃ¼tie, le groupe a écrit des dizaines de chansons et a sorti sa première démo studio Plan to Take Over the World en 1999. Le groupe a également sorti The Penelope EP en 1999, peu après lequel Stever a rejoint le groupe.
Kelley a quitté le groupe lors d'un concert à la fin de l'année 1999. Josh Eppard (alors batteur du groupe 3 de son frère, Joey Eppard) l'a remplacé. Le groupe sort Delirium Trigger en 2000, avec toujours Kelley à la batterie, mais en mentionnant Eppard dans les notes de pochette.
theaudiodb.name: Coheed and Cambria
